head.supplied: ¶ A quantity of the seeds of the Blue Gum tree is ready to be shipped to the Madras Government by next mail ¶ 12/9/64. ¶ ¶ Ferd Mueller....

div.p: J64/9136, unit 119, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

On 23 July 1864 the Secretary to Government, Madras wrote to the Chief Secretary, Melbourne requesting to be furnished with a supply of seeds of different forest trees indigenous to Victoria. The costs of collecting and shipping the seeds were to be paid by the Madras Government. The Under Secretary of Victoria, J. Moore, referred the file to M on 12 September.
See also M to J, McCulloch, 9 September 1864.
A quantity of the seeds of the Blue Gum tree is ready to be shipped to the Madras Government by next mail

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd Mueller.
Moore commented a year later on 14 August 1865: 'The matter is dealt with on another correspondence'. The file is annotated with two other file numbers. First is J64/8696 a letter to Treasurer, 9/9/64? Look up file could be the 'other' correspondence.
See also M to J. McCulloch, 19 January 1865.
